intro: Macleania smithiana, commonly known as the Smith's macleania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the western United States, particularly California, where it grows in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant is a shrub with evergreen leaves that are typically small and leathery. It produces white or pink flowers in clusters during the spring and summer months. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
